exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a wide grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Offers a big stretch on your lats, provides smooth even tension throughout the range of motion, feels great, and allows for easy overload by increasing the pin weight.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both the lats and mid traps due to the wide grip and pulling motion.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is selected because it's an S-tier exercise for back development, targeting both lats and mid traps.  The wide grip allows for a significant stretch and even tension throughout the movement, making it ideal for building back mass. It's also easily scalable by adjusting the weight.

exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a neutral grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Similar benefits to wide grip pull-downs but with more lat emphasis.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Emphasizes the lats more due to the neutral grip.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise provides a variation to the Wide Grip Lat Pulldown, focusing more on the lats. The neutral grip allows for a slightly different muscle activation pattern, ensuring comprehensive lat development.  It's also an S-tier exercise, indicating high effectiveness.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
exercises.execution_notes: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down and maintaining high tension in the stretched position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High tension in stretched position, locks elbows to prevent cheating, significant distal biceps growth.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Distal biceps, due to high tension in stretched position.
exercises.scientific_insights: Study shows preacher curls cause more distal biceps growth compared to incline curls.
exercises.selection_reason: This S-tier exercise is chosen for its effectiveness in targeting the distal biceps. The preacher curl's design ensures a full range of motion and maintains high tension in the stretched position, crucial for muscle growth.  Research supports its superior effectiveness compared to other curl variations.

exercises.setup_notes: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
exercises.tier_reasons: Maximum stretch and tension on biceps, even tension throughout range.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to high stretch and tension.
exercises.selection_reason: This S-tier exercise complements the Preacher Curl by providing a different angle and emphasizing the long head of the biceps. The cable provides consistent tension throughout the movement, maximizing muscle activation and promoting peak development.

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Twist your torso from side to side, keeping your core engaged. 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on your hands and knees.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Inhale, drop your belly towards the floor, and lift your chest and tailbone. Exhale, round your spine towards the ceiling, tucking your chin to your chest. Repeat for 1 minute.
Gently pull your elbow towards your body using your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. 30 seconds total.
